alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:11PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Johnson County through 415 PM MDT... At 311 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles northeast of Mayoworth, or 20 miles south of Buffalo, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Johnson County. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 276 and 288. Interstate 90 between mile markers 64 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
